alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 10:33PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF CHAUTAUQUA... CATTARAUGUS...SOUTHERN ERIE...AND WYOMING COUNTIES... A band of heavy lake effect snow will continue to drift south through the midnight hour. The heaviest snow will focus from the Chautauqua County shoreline and inland across the Chautauqua Ridge, Boston Hills, and Wyoming County. Snowfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour are likely in the heaviest portion of this band, resulting in visibility of less than a quarter mile and deep snow cover on roads. The band of heavy snow has moved south of the Buffalo Southtowns as of 1030PM, and will move farther south overnight with improving travel conditions across the Buffalo Southtowns. Be prepared for severe winter travel conditions. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 58 and 61, and the south end of Route 219. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
